DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To compare incidence peri-colonoscopy hyponatremia associate PEG 3350 + sport drink ( PEG-SD ) versus PEG 3350-electrolyte solution + sodium sulfate + sodium ascorbate ascorbic acid ( PEG-ELS ) . Hypothesis : As compare PEG-SD , hyponatremia occur significantly less often PEG-ELS .
DOC.detailed_description: Looking Incidence Hyponatremia With Two Commonly Prescribed Purgatives Colonoscopy-Polyethylene Glycol 3350 With Sports Drink ( PEG-SD ) Compared Polyethylene Glycol 3350 With Electrolyte Solution ( PEG-ELS )
DOC.criteria: Adults age 18 year old schedule elective outpatient colonoscopy : 8am noon . Unable unwilling consent Pregnant Breast feeding Significant psychiatric illness > 50 % colon resection Bowel obstruction History hyponatremia ( Serum sodium < 135 mmol/L ) End stage renal disease dialysis History chronic kidney disease ( kidney stone ) Decompensated cirrhosis , include : History bleed due portal hypertension ( varix , gastropathy , etc ) within 3 month Hepatic encephalopathy ( controlled medication ) within 3 month Clinical presence ascites Active cardiac disease Recent myocardial infarction ( < 4weeks ) Unstable angina Congestive heart failure NYHA Functional Class Stage III IV Stage III : Marked limitation activity . Less ordinary activity ( e.g . walk short distance , 20100 ) cause fatigue , palpitation , dyspnea . Comfortable rest . Stage IV : Severe limitation . Experiences symptoms even rest .
